research_topic: Comparative analysis of /task command versus /lean implement command for LEAN 4 proof development
research_questions: Does using the /task command provide all the same advantages that using the /lean implement command does?
Which command provides access to tactic-specialist, term-mode-specialist, metaprogramming-specialist?
Which command integrates with lean-lsp-mcp server for real-time proof development?
Can /task fully replace /lean implement for proof development?
key_findings: Commands serve fundamentally different purposes and are NOT interchangeable
14 specialist agents referenced in architecture but NOT FOUND in codebase
3 CRITICAL missing specialists: tactic-specialist, term-mode-specialist, metaprogramming-specialist
/task handles task management and planning; /lean handles proof implementation
Both commands needed for complete LEAN proof workflow
critical_discoveries: proof-developer agent cannot delegate as designed
recommendations: Use /task for TODO.md task execution and planning
Do NOT use /task expecting direct proof implementation
Create 3 CRITICAL specialists (tactic, term-mode, metaprogramming) as high priority

sources_consulted: Agent specifications (orchestrator, task-executor, proof-developer, implementer, researcher)
research_methodology.verification_method: Direct codebase analysis and file verification

impact_assessment.user_impact: High - Clarifies command usage and prevents misuse

next_steps: User: Use /task for TODO.md tasks, /lean for proof implementation
Development: Create 3 CRITICAL specialists (tactic, term-mode, metaprogramming)
Documentation: Update architecture to match implementation OR implement missing agents
